raw_text: Chris Nattress is a Technical Lead at Smart Moving with 10+ years of software engineering experience. He's an analytical visionary who designs systems that make complexity feel simple. His career spans from founding Ski Resort Data Services (95% client retention) to leading microservices transformations at Inntopia (94% faster deployments, 60% reduction in development time) and Progressive Leasing (fintech platform processing $500M+ annually with 99.95% uptime). Currently leading global distributed teams across Asia and Latin America. Technical expertise spans C# .NET, Angular, Vue.js, React, AWS, Azure, microservices architecture, and AI integration. He's an early adopter of AI development tools (Windsurf, Cursor, Claude) and built an AI-powered portfolio at chrisnattress.com. His problem-solving approach follows: Observe → Deconstruct → Model → Prototype → Iterate → Integrate. Core principle: create frameworks that enable teams to solve similar problems independently. Values systems thinking, evidence-based decisions, documentation-first approach, and team enablement. Promoted to Technical Lead within 3 months at Progressive Leasing. Successfully mentored distributed teams and established standards across 5 teams. Prefers strategic autonomy within clear systems, complex architectural challenges, and organizations valuing documentation and continuous learning.

identity.core_description: Analytical Visionary - A structured dreamer who sees systems as evolving patterns to decode and improve. Technical architect who transforms complexity into simplicity for both humans and machines.
identity.self_perception: Systems architect and reflective leader. Designer of frameworks that make complexity feel simple.
beliefs: Complexity should be made simple for humans and machines
Teams should solve problems independently after learning frameworks
Distributed teams are strengths, not constraints

cognition.thinking_style: Systematic and reflective. Frames problems in interconnected layers. Sees ripple effects and cascade dynamics.
cognition.decision_making: Evidence-based with strategic patience. Waits until variables are visible before committing to solutions. Resists premature optimization.
cognition.learning_style: Through observation, deconstruction, modeling, prototyping, iteration, and integration. Early adopter of new technologies with careful evaluation.
cognition.problem_solving: Observe → Deconstruct → Model → Prototype → Iterate → Integrate. Views challenges as systems awaiting articulation.
cognition.risk_tolerance: Calculated risk taker who prototypes to validate assumptions before scaling. Comfortable with ambiguity until clarity emerges.

patterns: Starts with comprehensive system understanding before proposing solutions
Creates templates and frameworks for reuse
Leads distributed teams across time zones
Continuously refines approach based on outcomes
habits: Systematic code review and architectural planning
Early adoption and evaluation of new tools
routines: Deep work sessions for architectural thinking
Continuous learning from LLM tools and frameworks
behavior.social_behavior: Collaborative leader who builds psychological safety through clear frameworks. Prefers meaningful conversation to small talk. Balances confidence with humility.
behavior.energy_level: High and consistent. Uses humor and detachment to regulate frustration. Energized by complex problems and team growth.

communication.tone: Professional yet approachable - technical depth without ego. Expresses ideas in structured layers with narrative flair.
communication.style: Specific over generic. Uses real metrics, technologies, and examples. Systems-oriented showing interconnections.
communication.vocabulary: Technical with business context. Uses patterns, frameworks, systems terminology. Clear and structured communication.
communication.non_verbal: Thoughtful listener. Asks clarifying questions. Shows curiosity while respecting others' expertise.

challenges: Tendency to over-contextualize ideas in communication
Cognitive overload from running multiple mental simulations
Sometimes delays action while ensuring system perfection

primary: AI-powered development tools and LLM integration

goals: Design systems that scale with team growth
aspirations: Principal Engineer or Chief Architect role
Mentor next generation of system architects
Innovate at intersection of AI and architecture

relationships.relational_style: Collaborative and supportive. Builds psychological safety through clear frameworks. Prefers depth over breadth in relationships.
relationships.role_in_groups: Technical leader and mentor. Brings systematic thinking and framework creation.
relationships.influence: High influence through technical expertise, system design, and framework adoption. Influences 30+ engineers across 5 teams.

work_style.environment_preference: Remote-friendly with distributed team experience. Async-first communication. Deep work sessions for architecture.
work_style.ideal_role: Technical Lead, Senior Engineer, or Architect role. Complex systems transformation focus.
work_style.team_size: 6 direct reports optimal. Comfortable scaling influence across multiple teams.
work_style.company_stage: Comfortable with startups, scale-ups, and enterprises. Proven success across all stages.
work_style.industries: Open to all. Proven expertise in fintech, hospitality, healthcare, e-commerce, SaaS.
work_style.work_hours: Flexible. Values deep work time and async-friendly culture over rigid schedules.
